{"step_by_step_thinking": "The binder in dental castings is a crucial component that provides strength and rigidity to the investment. It holds the ingredients together, ensuring the stability of the casting. It doesn't necessarily bring about a reduction in expansion, nor is it usually a form of silica. The binder can be safely heated above 700°C when present in the form of gypsum, but this is not its primary function.", "answer_choice": "B"}
